Summary “But I’m not good with numbers”. I wish I had a dollar for every time I heard students utter those words during my employment at both ASU and MSU.  
 
Working in an industry driven by Big Data, I don’t hear that expression anymore. But I do hear question after question about how to better analyze and use the vast amounts of information now at our finger-tips. Answering such questions is where I excel. 
 
I am good with numbers for several reasons: 
 
	I’m curious…first answers and surface results are never enough…I’m always looking for more 
 
	I know what I know and I’m dedicated to learning what I don’t know 
 
	Analysis is one thing, presentation is another…I’m good at both 
 
	I’m visually creative 
 
	I expect methodological integrity and consistency, anything less is unacceptable 
 
	I’m an expert who thinks like a lay-person 
 
My current predictive analytics research interests include the following: retail demand modeling in highly differentiated product industries, retail price optimization (base, promotional, and markdown pricing), competitive price intelligence, value measurement analytics, identification and measurement of demand transference, and data-driven pricing strategy analysis. 
 
Please don’t hesitate to reach out to me if you want to hear more about my passion and experience with data science – I’m always excited to share and even more excited to listen and learn from others.
